title: Turkish Lira Tumbles After Erdogan Defends Rate Cuts
sub_head: Currency has depreciated by nearly a third this month
body:
Turkeyâ€™s currency crisis intensified after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan defended an unorthodox policy of cutting interest rates to fight soaring inflation.
The Turkish lira traded at an all-time low of 12.50 lira to $1, having depreciated another 7% Tuesday. It has lost nearly a third of its value since the beginning of the month, falling 10 days in a row, according to FactSet.
